meanings.definition: To shake or tremble from cold or fear.
meanings.sent1: She shivered in the chilly wind.
meanings.sent2: The puppy shivered in fear during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent3: The little girl shivered with excitement as she waited for her birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The old house shivered as the strong wind rattled its windows.
meanings.sent5: The leaves shivered on the tree branches in the autumn breeze.

meanings.definition: To break into small pieces or fragments.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally shivered the glass when he dropped it.
meanings.sent2: The mirror shivered into a thousand tiny shards when it fell.
meanings.sent3: The cookie shivered into crumbs when she took a bite.
meanings.sent4: The ice shivered into pieces as he struck it with a hammer.
meanings.sent5: The delicate vase shivered into fragments when it slipped from her hands.

meanings.definition: To cause to shake or tremble.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder shivered the windows of the house.
meanings.sent2: His booming voice shivered the calm of the room.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news shivered her composure.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake shivered the ground beneath their feet.
meanings.sent5: The powerful music shivered the audience with emotion.
